articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel's cabinet approved a deal with Palestinian militant group Hamas for a ceasefire and release of hostages in the Gaza Strip, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Saturday, a day ahead of the agreement's scheduled start.
articles.title: Israeli cabinet approves Gaza ceasefire accord, due to take effect Sunday

articles.author: Tim Reid, Doina Chiacu
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration will take place inside the U.S. Capitol on Monday rather than outdoors because of severe cold, the first time in 40 years that U.S. presidential inaugural ceremonies will be moved indoors.
articles.title: Severe cold forces Trump inauguration indoors, first time in 40 years

articles.author: Michelle Nichols, Emma Farge
articles.description: Attacks on aid convoys in the Gaza Strip by looters and armed gangs could decline as humanitarian relief floods the area after the truce takes effect between Israel and Palestinian militants, the head of the U.N. Palestinian relief agency UNRWA said on Friday.
articles.title: Flooding Gaza with aid might lessen security challenge, says UNRWA chief

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk, Max Hunder
articles.description: Many Ukrainians have scant faith in Donald Trump's promises to swiftly strike a peace deal after he enters the White House on Monday.
articles.title: Trump the saviour? Anxious Ukrainians question president's power to end war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tens of thousands of anti-government protesters in Belgrade on Friday stood in silence in front of the state television RTS building for 15 minutes to commemorate victims of a railway station roof collapse for which they blame Serbian authorities.
articles.title: Tens of thousands join student-led protests in Belgrade

articles.author: Andrew Chung, John Kruzel
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court upheld on Friday a law banning TikTok in the United States on national security grounds if its Chinese parent company ByteDance does not sell the short-video app by Sunday, as the justices in a 9-0 decision declined to rescue a platform used by about half of all Americans.
articles.title: US Supreme Court upholds law banning TikTok

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Pakistani court sentenced former Prime Minister Imran Khan to 14 years imprisonment on Friday in a land corruption case, local broadcaster ARY News reported.
articles.title: Pakistan court sentences ex-PM Imran Khan to 14 years in land graft case, ARY News reports

articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin, Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and his Iranian counterpart Masoud Pezeshkian deepened military ties between their countries on Friday by signing a 20-year strategic partnership that is likely to worry the West.
articles.title: Putin and Iran's president deepen defence ties with 20-year pact

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Yoon Suk Yeol,South Korea's impeached president, plans to attend a court hearing on Saturday to fight a request by investigators to extend his detention on accusations of insurrection, his lawyer said.
articles.title: South Korea's President Yoon to attend court hearing on extending detention

articles.author: Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Trump faces fewer guardrails as he pursues a norm-shattering agenda that is already upending Washington and unsettling the world.
articles.title: Once an interloper, Trump returns to White House more powerful than before
